title: The Zero Product Property
text: The zero product property says if the product of two quantities is zero, it must be that at least one of the quantities is zero.
speech: The zero product property says if the product of two quantities is zero, it must be that at least one of the quantities is zero.
pacedSpeech: The zero product property says if the product of two quantities is zero, it must be that at least one of the quantities is zero.

title: Factoring the Equation
text: To factor this equation, we must expand and re-factor. $$\left(y-3\right) \left(y+2\right)=y^2-y-6$$. So, we have $$y^2-5y-6=0$$. Factoring this, we get $$\left(y-6\right) \left(y+1\right)=0$$
speech: To factor this equation, we must expand and re-factor.  parentheses y minus 3,  times, parentheses y plus 2,  is equal to y squared minus y minus 6 . So, we have  y squared, minus 5 y minus 6 is equal to 0 . Factoring this, we get  parentheses y minus 6,  times, parentheses y plus 1,  is equal to 0
pacedSpeech: To factor this equation, we must expand and re-factor.    y minus 3,  times,  y plus 2,  is equal to y squared minus y minus 6
. So, we have   y squared, minus 5 y minus 6 is equal to 0
. Factoring this, we get    y minus 6,  times,  y plus 1,  is equal to 0

title: Using the Zero Product Property
text: As per the zero product property, if $$\left(y-6\right) \left(y+1\right)=0$$, then either $$y-6$$ or $$y+1$$ is equal to $$0$$. Setting both of these to $$0$$, $$y=6$$, $$y=-1$$. Summing these values, we get $$5$$
speech: As per the zero product property, if  parentheses y minus 6,  times, parentheses y plus 1,  is equal to 0 , then either  y, minus 6  or  y, plus, 1  is equal to  0 . Setting both of these to  0 ,  y is equal to 6 ,  y, is equal to, negative 1 . Summing these values, we get  5
